body: Great job with the angle normalization every where it is required. However, as a tip to improve the code, you could define this implementation in a function that you can call every time you need normalization, while just changing the arguments you pass to the function. This will help gain some time.

LIDAR here is linear. This means that we do not need to use the unscented transformation here. Using the linear Kalman filter update equations just like in the EKF project should give the same results and has the advantage to require less computational resources. Thus, better Real Time performance.

This expression `2*n_aug_+1` can actually be expressed in a variable and then called any time you need it. This expression is called multiple times over the course of the algorithm. Instead of computing it multiple times you can greatly improve the Real Time performance by doing it just once.
